questions.question: What is the capital of France?
questions.statement: The capital of France is Paris.

questions.question: Which planet is known as the Red Planet?
questions.statement: The planet known as the Red Planet is Mars.

questions.question: What is the largest mammal in the world?
questions.statement: The largest mammal in the world is the Blue Whale.

questions.question: Which element has the chemical symbol 'Au'?
questions.statement: Au is the chemical symbol for Gold.

questions.question: What is the largest organ in the human body?
questions.statement: The skin is the largest organ in the human body.

questions.question: Which country is home to the Great Barrier Reef?
questions.statement: The Great Barrier Reef is located off the coast of Australia.

questions.question: What is the smallest prime number?
questions.statement: 2 is the smallest and only even prime number.

questions.question: Which vitamin is produced by the body when exposed to sunlight?
questions.statement: Vitamin D is produced by the body when skin is exposed to sunlight.

questions.question: What is the hardest natural substance on Earth?
questions.statement: Diamond is the hardest natural substance found on Earth.

questions.question: Which bird lays the largest egg?
questions.statement: The Ostrich lays the largest eggs of any bird species.

questions.question: What is the capital of Japan?
questions.statement: Tokyo is the capital city of Japan.

questions.question: Which planet is closest to the Sun?
questions.statement: Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun in our solar system.

questions.question: What is the main component of the Sun?
questions.statement: The Sun is primarily composed of Hydrogen.

questions.question: Which ocean is the largest?
questions.statement: The Pacific Ocean is the largest and deepest ocean on Earth.

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for silver?
questions.statement: Ag is the chemical symbol for silver.

questions.question: Which is the longest river in the world?
questions.statement: The Nile River is the longest river in the world.
